los.title: 1.1: What's The Perfect Plan?
los.preview: Why a defined, rational planning process matters.

snippets.title: Body
snippets.body: The individual defines the "perfect" financial plan; it’s their money and their values. A rational process creates focus, reduces uncertainty, and builds confidence.

snippets.title: Body
snippets.body: Objectivity is thinking for yourself, guided by knowledge. It favors clear methods over products, improves confidence, and helps with independent conclusions.

snippets.title: Body
snippets.body: Your values and priorities drive trade-offs. Exercises like value ranking and objective drafting clarify the plan you actually want to implement.

los.title: 2.1: Being Real
los.preview: Ground your plan in realistic spending.

snippets.title: Body
snippets.body: Start with honest baselines. Reality-based inputs make the rest of the math meaningful and prevent fragile plans.

snippets.title: Body
snippets.body: Use categories that match your life. Iterate until the structure feels natural and decisions become easier.

snippets.title: Body
snippets.body: Inflation shapes long-term affordability. Use reasonable assumptions and revisit them periodically.
